wikipedia_page.main: Frank Englefield (August 1878 – 1945) was an English professional footballer who played for Southampton in the late 1890s, generally at outside-left  although his only Southern League appearance came at left-half.

response: Married to Beatrice Englefield in 1908, he had two sons, Ronald and Frank. Beatrice's brother, Frank Englefield, was also a professional footballer, playing for both Southampton and Fulham.

Other players who started their careers at Freemantle include Frank Englefield, James McKie and Henry Small, while Sid Cavendish, Joe French, Ernest Gill and Ernie Taylor all played for Freemantle at some time in their careers.
